Key Arguments: The bill is seen as dangerous and ineffective in combating harmful internet content.
Concerns about who decides what constitutes disinformation across various topics.
Skepticism about ACMA's ability to accurately judge misinformation without professional input.
Lack of clear definitions for terms like 'serious harm' could lead to arbitrary censorship.
The government has not provided sufficient examples of harm caused by misinformation to justify the bill.
Historical instances of government censorship during the COVID pandemic raise concerns about potential misuse.
Main Themes: Effectiveness and justification of the legislation
Notable Quotes: Although I am a staunch supporter of government attempts to control hate speech, this bill is deficient - if not downright dangerous.
The ultimate arbiters of truth will be either the government itself or unelected bureaucrats.
I strongly urge you to do what you can to quash this bill. I fear that it will seriously erode one of the crucial pillars of this great country - our democracy.
